name: Homophthalic acid anhydride
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4505
Reason: 1,3,4-thiadiazole ring formation introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, further raising the melting point. Each additional phenyl group can add approximately +30 to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions and rigidity. The anhydride functionalities introduce additional carbonyl interactions, which can raise the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, which can lower the melting point by approximately -10 degrees Celsius. The thiadiazole ring formation introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, further raising the melting point.
